dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's why it's great.  To have a real friend.  When you're.  Lonely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last word was a tough one.  It makes her nod.  She st his eyes for the longest time.  And when she speaks, he c hear her voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you have to stay tomorrow. To sign the papers.  But.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But.  One word.  And even a stupid guy.  Gets it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be heading back.  Before Herry.  Misses me.  Too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.  He nods, dumbly.  Watching his worst nightmare unfo his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Her voice chokes a little on that.  She shakes her head, grinning at how foolish she feels.  She smiles at him now she means it. And leaves.  Without another word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did stay my friend.  In her way. Even tho, for awhile, we didn't see each other a lot.

dialogues.text: He wants to cry.  He wants to be sick.  He doesn't know w wants.  Fumbles in his pocket for some wadded-up bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Stay with us.  My kid follows yours around, they'll bunk t'gether.  And we gotta fluffy couch that's more'n you deserve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's two years.  My boat's ready. If I stay any longer, I'll begin to like it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't want that.  Very silent at this table.  Against the place.  Is he serious? NUTBEEM (softly) I'm throwing myself a farewell party on Saturday.  Departure to follow Sunday.  Regrets, soon after, no doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And smiles.  Serious as a heart attack.  A long beat. QUOYLE (a murmur) Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: It was so big, I thought it was a tea cozy for your car.  But if it's for me, it has to be bigger, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on, put it on!  So he slips it over his head.  Big and then some.  This worries her.  She plucks at it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kiddin'?  After the holidays, we'll have to stretch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just beaming.  Hugs himself to show how warm it is. silence is companionable.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not used to a woman.  Giving me presents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises a brow.  Can scarcely believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Christmas with Petal, I gave her eleven things.  And I wrapped them. And watched her open them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds her friendly smile.  But her eyes have changed. Slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't have anything for me. Like every year.  But this one time, she said, 'Wait a minute.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ran to the kitchen.  I heard the fridge open.  She came back. With her hands hidden behind her. Then, she held out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even his voice.  Betrays the longing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two brown eggs.  She gave them to me from her own hands.  They were cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must sound really stupid.  But they meant a lot to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  A soft...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  It's the thought that counts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.  He's glad she understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I broke 'em, careful.  Made her an omelette with 'em.  And I saved the shells.  In a little box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't help but show her surprise at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeh.  They're on a shelf behind my desk.  At the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks worried now.  Shouldn't have brought this up.  A this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how it is.  To hold onto something good.  In the middle of all the bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.  But feels truly awkward now.  So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  I gotta collect Bunny. Beety's gonna have supper waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  She nods.  She understands this, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  Thank you, very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes her teapot and her bracelet.  Holds them.  A gentle Her hands now too full for a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  Merry Christmas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a wonderful smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one of her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quoyle enters a packed auditorium, festooned for Christ's with every trimming imaginable.  Rough fishermen in black they wear once a year, women in finery, schoolkids at the scrubbed best, antsy with anticipation.  The BUZZ is audi palpable.  No Broadway opening could hope for this level eagerness. As Quoyle comes down the aisle, we see faces we know.  Bo Nutbeem's party.  Billy Pretty with Jack and Mrs. Buggit. Yark and his bird-like wife.  The old-timer who sold Quoy boat.  Mavis Bangs with an empty seat next to her, must b for Agnis.  All the kids from daycare.  Still, Quoyle sea the face he doesn't find.  And finally... ...to the third row, where Dennis and Beety have saved hi Beety gives him a peck on the cheek, and he smiles, settl nervous as hell, just as... ...the school principal, still dressed for England, walks mike at center stage.  Holds up her hands like the discip she prides herself on being, and they quiet pretty fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friends and neighbors, and most of all, your children.  Have worked hard to bring you the best pageant ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDEROUS applause, whistling, stamping.  She is frustra moment.  Then, waves cheerily against the din, shouting..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LET THE FESTIVITIES BEGIN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And RUNS off-stage, as we DISSOLVE THROUGH a SERIES OF AN ...the Big Ugly Guy who led the raid on poor Nutbeem's bo in a threadworn suit bulging with his bulk, singing DANNY the sweetest tenor one could dream of.  PAN an audience, motionless.  Pavarotti never had more respect. ...Bunny and Marty walk timidly to the front of the stage dressed in Christmas reds and greens.  Bunny all in blue, does look good on her.  Kids CALL OUT their names.  The p quiet.  And the girls begin to sing a plaintive West Afri in small brave voices that sometimes harmonize.  It is un and breathtakingly courageous.  Two dads in the third row tears flooding their eyes... DENNIS (gruff whisper) Not bad, my kid, eh? QUOYLE (gruffer whisper) I'll say.  She's as good as mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Agnis Hamm walks out alone onto the stage, wearing a b jersey, tweed skirt, yellow stockings and red slippers. an odd look on her face, all serious and curious.  The la calls die away to silence.  Suddenly, one of her feet SCR the stage, her arms become WINGS, and with a CROONING and she metamorphoses into a PEEVISH HEN protecting an egg. comes DOWN with laughter and UNISON applause.  Quoyle gla at Mavis Bangs who puts her fingers between her teeth and in pure delight. ...Wavey Prowse walks onto the rear of the stage, in a lo smock, carrying her accordion.  She turns to the wings, n out comes little Herry clacking across the stage in tap s beat of silence.  Mom calls out:  ONE, TWO, THREE, rolls savage hornpipe and Herry commences the JIG Quoyle once g through a window.  Three hundred HEELS coming STOMPING do perfect rhythm and lift Herry into a joyous bouncing, rat performance that builds in intensity until the finish.  H to the edge of the stage, bows DEEP from the waist, stand in their applause.  Then RACES offstage, his mom followin dignity, and we go with her into the wings... Once there, Wavey slips OUT of the smock, revealing to th of the wings, that she is wearing dancer's tights over dr legs.  A close-fitting tunic covered with sequins and gla crystal diamonds, and dozens more glittering baubles that shimmer of prisms with her every breath.  Herry hands her hat, a cane, and... ...she STALKS back onto the stage, her lithe body strutti glinting.  A hush of stupefaction falls, only to be washe by SHOUTS and WHISTLES, the kind of which have not been h since Gypsy Rose Lee startled her first roomful of rubes. the bedlam... ...she TWIRLS the top hat on one finger, FLIPS it up in a somersault, catching it square on her head.  She leans on And when at last they quiet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all know Billy Pretty's ways. Never save fifty cents, if you can save a dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She winks.  They laugh.  Billy laughing loudest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, last Feb'ry, Billy wants t'get his grandfather clock repaired. Calls old Leander Mesher.  Local call.  No charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twirls the cane recklessly.  In the third row, a goggle-e couldn't blink if he tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, says Leander, the big cost is pickup and delivery.  Got t'charge fifty dollars, each way.  Two strong boys.  Gasoline.  Air in the tires!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no cost for air in yer tires!, says Bill.  Get wi' th'times, he's told.  Tis called inflation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAGGLES her eyebrows, Groucho-style.  They are busting th laughing.  Connoisseurs of wit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy lives at the top of the hill, Leander at the bot tom, doncha know. So Billy gets a rope, HOISTS the grandfather UP on his back.  And muttering the words fifty bucks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her toe out, SLIPS wildly, windmilling her arms, pantomiming as she bends double under the phantom clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mite slick.  Four feet thick a ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears are streaming from a hundred eyes and more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, at the bottom, Auntie Fizzard, 91 years young, sets out in her non-slip galoshes and her cane with the rubber tip.  Didn't yer, dearie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bows to the old gal in the front row, who is scarlet-face hysterics, as all around her applaud.  Wavey becomes her, along, casting fierce glances right and left to warn the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, at the top...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is Billy once more, beneath his burden, her long legs stepping to one side, then the other, slipping, skidding, howling all around her threatening to shatter walls, and.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...OVER he goes, clock-side down, and PICKIN' UP SPEED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miming the wild ride as they ROAR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...eight blocks, NINE, missing everything like a miracle, zeroing in on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She becomes Auntie Fizzard once more, shuffling, looking right, and suddenly up WILD-EYED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLIPS 'er inta the snow bank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nods sadly.  Leaning on her cane.  When at last they quie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just two galoshes stickin' outta the snow.  She digs 'er way out. Brushes herself off.  Looks at him sprawled like a turtle on his back, tied to his massive burden. She says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU THERE!  BILLY PRETTY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levels a dead-eyed killer gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHY CAN'T YOU WEAR A WRISTWATCH LIKE EVER'BODY ELSE?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place comes DOWN like a house of cards.  Bedlam surro Quoyle who sits still as a stone.  Too dazzled to breathe EXT. ROADSIDE DINER - EARLY MORNING. Lonely stretch of wooded road, middle of nowhere.  Light starting to fall.  A truck pulls up beneath a tree.  Out ...Wavey.  Looking grim, walking slow.  Crosses the road weathered diner.  The woman who only smokes when she's wo pulls out a pack of Camels.  Looks through the diner's fr window... ...a lone customer sits nursing his coffee.  He is 40, le attractive.  Dark hard eyes, set into worries of their ow lights up.  Watches in silence until... ...the man looks up.  Their eyes meet through the glass. And on his faint smile... She turns her back.  Starts up the road. ANGLE...he is walking beside her now.  Snow drifting lazy smoke curling up.  He watches her anger, how cold and qui closed.  Smiles at her profile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shoulda come last night.  Seen the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't even believe he said that.  Never looking at hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woulda been a thrill for the Christians among' em.  They think you're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep walking.  His smile is gentle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then we got good news for th...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So does your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even better news for him. WAVEY (low) You think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaking the words off.  He's watching her profile. HEROLD (very soft) I can't undo the hurt I've done. Unless you let me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gauging the feeling behind the bitterness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a million reasons to send me away.  Good ones.  And only two reasons not to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she even listening?  He lets the silence hang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.  And you love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops walking.  Flips her cigarette off into the snow now... Looks into his face.  And sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rear ANGLE of Agnis, crouching in the lightly falling sno edge of the sea.  The spot where she once sent her dog to HEAR footfalls crunching slowly across the rocks.  A bulk comes into frame.  Crouches down beside her.  Close.  She the gray horizon. QUOYLE (softly) Mavis Bangs.  Told me where you'd be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.  But she hears him all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get so little mention in the wires.  Thought you'd like to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the folded print-out to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head in the suitcase.  The mystery's solved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks briefly at his eyes.  Takes it.  Starts to read

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silver Melville was captured in Moored with a cruise steward.  The boy was twenty, a looker, wearing Armani clothes.  Driving a nice Lexus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnis keeps reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says she did it all for love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods at that.  Folds the paper neatly, as if conveyin Hands it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd call me, time to time. Husband was a pig.  More women should do what she done.  Her situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks in her eyes.  And decides to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some women.  Shoulda done it to their brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The look holds.  She sees the compassion in his eyes.  Kn so on her side.  She clears her throat. AGNIS (softly) Cousin Nolan.  Hafta pay him a visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a look.  He glances at the sea.  Beautiful spo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mavis said you buried Warren here. Called it an anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares deep and unblinking into his eyes.  She will t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of a loss.  But not the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A held moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes us do that, nephew? Give ourselves away to someone. So we can't eat or think or breathe without 'em? QUOYLE (just above a whisper) I don't know.  We just do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now she smiles.  Something we have rarely seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene Warren died.  The mornin' after a Christmas.  We get one true love in life, nephew.  She was mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not surprised.  And that, in turn, does not really s her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mean we can't give love again.  And get some back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For some, it does. AGNIS (straight back) Not for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strong with that.  Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if that ruffles some small town feathers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His smile in return.  Very real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know what the feathers around here need th' most?  A good ruffling, I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sounds pretty sure himself.  Their look ho1ds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know what I need th' most?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A really big breakfast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, one last time.  Sounds like a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quoyle alone with his cut-and-paste, making up the front layout.  Moonlight on fallen snow through the window.  La quiet enough, to hear... ...the vehicle drive up, the engine turn off.  The footfa door, which swings open.  The last person he'd expect to Especially with a bottle.  Of Cuervo Gold. They stare at each other.  Only he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shoots him a quizzical look.  We see the edge right o if he doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night.  On the stage?  You were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shakes his head with innocent admiration.  She puts the b his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was easy.  I just kept thinkin'. How would Petal do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears it now, right enough.  The anger, the Cuervo.  S on over to the coffee counter, only a bit wobbly.  Plucks styrofoam cups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're friends, right?  Friends drink together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to his desk.  Shrugs her coat off onto the floor.  P and jeans, she looks terrific.  Hikes her butt up onto th his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked a quest... QUOYLE (quiet) I'll drink with you.  If you're not done yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her soft throaty laugh.  He hasn't seen her this way.  Ca if it's more scary or exciting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not drunk enough yet to talk about Petal.  Which we always seem to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opens the bottle.  About four fingers are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk about me.  Which we don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pours herself another two.  Thinks before she says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Growin' up, all I wanted from this place was out.  Imagine.  Give up all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pours two fingers for him.  Stretches her body to slide t across the desk.  The Cuervo sloshes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran off to Toronto, went to school.  Wanted to be a social worker.  For kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's looking at her cup now.  Not at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Came back one summer.  Fell for Herold Prowse.  That.  Was that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes a swallow.  Closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know I was a liar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opens her eyes.  Straight into his.  Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herold liked other women.  But you know how that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you do. WAVEY (whispers) He didn't die.  Not that he didn't deserve to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quoyle blinks.  A perfect stunned ox gape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I'm a good liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drains her cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ran off to Seattle with some bitch.  When his damaged son was two months old.  And nobody knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ice-cold wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said.  It's four years ago. And it's yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pours herself another.  Savors the memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I took his boat out.  I sunk it. And told my little story.  Grieving widow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrugs a drunken, careless shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was leaving, of course.  Why humiliate myself on the wayout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? WAVEY (softer) But a funny thing happened.  On my way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes are deeper now.  And for a beat, the anger slips

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these funny, odd little folks? They put their hearts around me. So I wouldn't be alone.  Having lost the man I loved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  A real one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And since I knew, to my shame, that is exactly what I had lost.  I let go of the will to leave.  I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decided to let my child grow up. Around folks better than his mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stares in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're quite the talker. QUOYLE (quiet) I take pride in that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she smiles.  But the bitterness is there in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this morning.  The man I loved.  Came back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the world.  Ceases to spin.  One man's world, at leas watches that.  Assesses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told me he knew.  I loved him still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sips at her second drink.  Slides the rest of it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Now I'm drunk enough.  To talk about Petal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes ask.  Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're thinking we're kindred souls, you and me.  In love with our nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shakes her head.  Uh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't love your Petal.  You hate.  Her cheating.  Guts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Means those words as an opening blow.  Jacks or better. the hole card...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to think it's love. Because if it's not, you're dead inside.  So you keep that flame a flickering.  Cos it's all you'll ever have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pure contempt.  And honesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see.  You're a good liar, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lifts the cap.  Screws it back on the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the damn eggshells?  That's all I came to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And from his prison of shock and shame.  He points to a s is OFF his desk, like a panther... ...SNATCHES the tiny padded box with its treasure.  RAISE to smash it, and... ...stops.  To see the panic.  In his eyes. It brings tears.  Pooling in hers. And she sets the treasure down, with the tenderness that requires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you guess how I know about Petal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cannot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you and I.  Are kindred souls.  After all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that.  Is what she came to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I told my husband.  To fuck himself.  And the ego he rode in on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses the floor.  Scoops up her coat.  Walks, just wobbly, to the door.  Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nods.  Means that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I don't see you.  Happy New Year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And leaves.  The door closes quietly.  Quoyle looks from the eggshells. And back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE...Dennis and his wife BEETY bundled together asleep ferocious storm HOWLS around the house. ANGLE...Quoyle awake on the sofa in Dennis' parlor.  Clut blankets around him.  Eyes jumping with every SHRIEK of t marauding wind.  Mind racing with thoughts of Wavey.  And eggshells. ANGLE...Bunny asleep with Dennis' daughter MARTY.  The ro to vibrate under the violence of the weather's assault. Bunny now, and... ...her eyes OPEN.  A strange intent in them.  A knowledge slips from Marty's bed in her thin blue nightdress.  Thro house in the dark, as the wind SCREAMS its warning.  Into lor where her father sleeps, as the wind suddenly INVADES ...SUCKS her straight UP the chimney and out INTO the hea storm.  SAILING like a loosened kite out across the black Out and out, as gray light rises, to... ...Quoyle Point, where she is blown FLAT against a granit just in front of the Green House, which SHIVERS and plead the wind, its steel cables STRAINING, and suddenly from w house, lights come ON... ...the WHITE DOG is in a window.  No longer snarling and but whining pitifully, begging to be saved.  And on the s floor... ...PETAL alone, wild-eyed with terror.  She is dressed al and her daisy-chain necklace flies about her throat as sh against the glass, her eyes staring directly AT her daugh can only scream soundlessly against the gale as the house ...begins to come LOOSE, the first cable SNAPPING and WHI about with the fierce destructiveness of unleashed power, NEXT, and ANOTHER, and with Petal still visible, HOWLING windows BURSTING everywhere else like flash bulbs, the ho ...slides FREE, along the rocks, toward the cliff, Bunny as it goes OVER the edge, TUMBLES down toward the sea, an ...sits BOLT UPRIGHT in bed, a single GASP as her dad is holding her tight.  She is soaked with sweat.  But her ey wild.  They are filled with the knowing. BUNNY (a whisper) Daddy.  The Green House is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smooths her hair.  The wind bellows in rage.  Little M somehow sleeps on, undisturbed, beside her. BUNNY (a whisper) I didn't dream it.  Don't say I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb from the station wagon into cold, clear sunlig Stare in wonder at the naked rock.  The snapped, spent, c Only shards of wood and glass leaving a hapless trail tow cliff. Bunny RUNS toward the debris, and through it.  To a tangl bushes near the cliff. He walks to a broken cable.  Crouches.  His eyes running space.  Where his ancestor's home once stood.  And then. turns... QUOYLE (calls out) What you got there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see now.  Bunny has unearthed a huge wooden crate from hiding place.  Too engrossed in counting its contents to As he comes over... BUNNY (not looking up) Petal's things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is counting her treasure trove of NECKLACES.  More th sound mind could imagine.  Yet, in their infinite variety wonderful.  A testimonial to the power of love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they're all here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up.  Sees him staring so fixedly at them. BUNNY (alerted) What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're beautiful.  I never saw 'em.  All together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  The kid doesn't smile.  She decides whether to ask h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will she be proud to wear 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks in her eyes.  His heart breaks behind his smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  Any woman would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steel gray morning.  The sea is more than a little rough, lays out his lobster traps.  Two other boats, not too clo appear and disappear in mist.  He is checking the lines, hefty weights onto the traps to take them down. JACK (sings to himself) Oh, th' Gandy Goose she ain't no uuuuse Cos all her nuts'n bolts is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stops.  Halfway to lowering the next trap over the side. JACK (mutters) Sweet Jesus.  I'm turnin' inta Alvin Cockadoodle Yark!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it nears the water line, Jack's cat SKIPPER TOM sudden down ONTO the trap.  Jack blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?  Suicide attempt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tries to let go of the trap and grab the cat in one motio cat JUMPS BACK to the boat, Jack STUMBLING out of his way the coiled line which WHIRRS as the trap goes... ...DOWN, the line STRANGLING Jack's leg and WHIPPING him OVER the side in one startling heartbeat.  Almost comic t But then.  It is very quiet.  Air bubbles appear at the s In a few seconds... The water is unbroken.  The boat bobs silently in the swe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quoyle and Alvin inspect Quoyle's newly-finished boat.  I beauty, to be sure, and the old builder watches Quoyle lo running his hand across the smooth gunnel.  Alvin doesn't That's not his style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta paint the name.  What'll it be? 'The Tall And Quiet Woman'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quoyle glances over.  The old boy's eyes are dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew Billy's dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever'body knows ever'body.  But Billy's pap didn't invent the Four Women in a Man's Life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quoyle nods.  Guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  Which one is Bunny, I wonder? The Maid in the Meadow, mebbe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Yoda is just staring at him.  And quietly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doncha know?  They're all the same woman.  That's the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His pupil blinks.  Like a crystal bullet of clarity his b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maid in the Meadow, that's her innocence and play.  The Stouthearted Woman, is when you need to lean on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For some reason he could never name.  Tears are pooling i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tall and Quiet Woman?  That's the silent partner who always walks 'longside, so's yer never alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quoyle is nodding, now.  It all seems so right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the Demon Lover.  That's just the frostin' on th' cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soft knocking at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When y'find the woman who's all four?  That's when y'got yer one true love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird-like woman enters.  The old man nods toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...like m'Gertie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she isn't alone.  A man enters behind her.  It is Den Buggit.  And there are tears on his face.  He brings a dr silence with him, because the face is an open grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad went over the side this mornin'.  Tangled in th' sling- stone line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sob escapes from this strong man's throat.  He ignores one knows what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you could write a memorial t' him.  Fer t'morrow's Gammy Bird? I'd be real grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The road is jammed with parked cars and trucks and vans a Folks still streaming toward the brightly-lit house.  Eve knows ever'body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every room is filled with folks who wear their best.  The eating and chatter and even some pockets of laughter, as through the crowd.  As if some have taken hold of a wake' meaning purpose.  Others stand dazed, still wearing their confusion.  There are children here, some hold a parent's some giggle with each other.  Snapshot of a community.  S to cope. Quoyle and Bunny enter, holding hands, looking around.  A cross the room... ...two figures step into their path.  Two women holding h their bodies close together.  Their feeling for each othe all to see.  One is Agnis.  And the other.  Isn't Mavis B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy New Year, Mr. Quoyle.  I'm sorry I missed you at the pageant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slightly startled, Quoyle can't help but smile, despite t occasion.  At the proud look on his aunt's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the wings, a course. Wasn't our girl somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our girl, a course, is Agnis.  Who nearly blushes at the compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, y'have t'love a woman.  Who's in touch with her inner chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who could argue with that.  Dawn leans up, kisses Q the cheek.  And with surprising softness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nephew.  You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's okay.  He's not sleeping in the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her great aunt looks at this child.  Bends to plant an un kiss on the top of Bunny's head.  The kid squirms, tugs h firmly off, as he sends a parting wave. Into the parlor now.  Quieter here, as the new arrivals t Jack Buggit in his open coffin, resting on black-draped s Dennis and his mom stand by Jack, a hand and a word for e moving into the line...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember what I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His words a murmur.  Hers are bolder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's not sleeping.  Why do they call it a awake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks.  As if it is a worthwhile question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the ones have to be awake. To how much we love him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nods to himself.  Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how we should be good to each other.  While we have the chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down.  They are almost there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is thinking.  Keeping the thoughts to herself.  At th now, he lifts her up to see.  Jack lies motionless, a wax himself.  Serene behind violet eyelids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks like he's sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis looks over.  His stolid, grim face releases a smil friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cos he's peaceful.  No worries, anymore.  No troubles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets her down.  Clasps Mrs. Buggit's hand.  And from h pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found this in Jack's drawer at the paper.  I don't know if it's somethin' special...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enameled wreath with the initial R, backed by a long, She tears up again, just to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's his lodge pin.  We were lookin' all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles bravely as she takes it.  Leans up to kiss his MRS. BUGGIT (a whisper) Dennis showed me what y'wrote fer th' paper.  Did Jack proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they look at each other.  Dennis clears his throat, lo And then, Quoyle is leading Bunny off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hungry?  There's sandwi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Petal's peaceful, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a statement of fact.  To no one in particular.  Dad her hand.  Manages...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.  You can count on tha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she lets go.  Scampers to a corner of the room.  To H Prowse.  And his mom. So Quoyle starts toward her, his heart in his throat.  An Wavey looks up.  She is glad to see him.  As he reaches h She holds up her wrist.  Dangling from it, her turquoise She wore her best for Jack.  Quoyle stands very close.  O thing from his pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New Year's present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small box.  Wrapped as careful as he could.  She looks eyes, really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeh.  It's a Quoyle tradition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, in that case.  She takes it into her slender finger the ribbon, the paper.  Lifts the lid to see, resting in ...eggshells.  Crushed almost to powder.  Her heart comes to her eyes, even before the whispered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  For the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And across the room, Mrs. Buggit leans with trembling han the Lodge pin to Jack's lapel.  Shaking as she is, the ha lurches, the big pin goes PLUNGING, and... ...a rattling COUGH.  Rolls across this room.  The world silent.  Jack's wife grabs her son's arm, and their eyes staring into the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD'S COME BACK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And LUNGES to help hs gurgling father free his shoulders coffin's wedge.  A sudden ROAR, there are SCREAMS, there LAUGHTER and WHISTLING, complete chaos.  And in the bedla on Quoyle's coat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See.  He woke up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlit day of crystal perfection.  The majesty of ice and rock and shimmering water.  A scale so majestic, any cyni hard put to deny God's hand.  And gliding into FRAME... ...a tiny skiff.  On its maiden run.  We CLOSE to see... ...painted on its side.  THE FOUR WOMEN.  One woman is ro now, doing all the work.  Her son sleeps in the bow.  And middle of the little boat... ...father and daughter.  Are unpacking the picnic lunch. a lot of food.  This could take awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a funny thing to say.  For the first thing he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  'I'm keepin' m'damn lobster license'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh.  That.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he just said it.  To make your Uncle Dennis laugh so hard. You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps unpacking.  Her face quiet and serious.  Her th own. QUOYLE (very softly) It's not fair, is it.  That Jack woke up.  And Petal didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And since he's said her thought aloud.  She tells him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  The world's not fair.  You said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not looking up.  But he knows she's listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's something the world is always teaching us.  And sometimes, the learning comes later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That gets through.  Both adults can see it. QUOYLE (a murmur) You taught me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes resolutely down, she nods.  Remembers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know.  What we wait for? It's like the main stem of this boat.  It gives us our shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her brow furrows.  Doesn't understand that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I know why you saved a place for Petal.  All this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On this.  She looks up.  Her dad is smiling from his eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cos I'm the daddy.  And you learn how to do.  By watching me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just watched.  Better than I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still holding Bunny's eyes.  He beckons to the woman rowi C'mere, a second.  So Wavey sets down her oars.  Slides o And Quoyle whispers to his daughter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans his face.  To Wavey's mouth.  A kiss so tender, child can't turn away.  The moment lingers.  And when it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thanking your daddy.  For all my presents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was only two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wavey looks at this girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than two.  Everything I need. Except...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except.  She gathers all the courage it takes to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except a necklace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And waits.  We can feel her heart pounding in her throat. stares back with eyes no one could read.  And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a box of 'em.  You could pick one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hush over this bay.  A woman stunned and grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'd have everything you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that seems true.  So, the woman nods.  Her eyes flu In the silence, she unwraps a sandwich... WAVEY (a murmur) You want the cheese?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then.  She hands that one to Quoyle.  And as she an look for another, we PULL... ...UP and AWAY, an AERIAL ANGLE swirling above the shimme The boat so far below us.  The people tiny specks.  They anyone. Anyone at all. FADE TO BLACK.  ROLL END CREDITS.
